website_summaries.verdict: Pre-molded for right- and left-specific ears in sizes for adults and children, and blue or pink colors.
pros: Good for deep pool and ocean swimming
Ears stay dry and offer good suction to keep out water
Can still hear talking even with plugs inserted
cons: Don't conform or mold for personal fit
May leak, not good for those who wear tubes in ears

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Amazing Earplugs and Worked Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a trip to the Caribbean where I knew I’d be snorkeling and doing a lot of water sports and activities. Last year I didn’t have any ear plugs and ended up getting so much water in my ears it took 3 days of being completely deaf that I decided I needed to get something to keep that from happening. These worked great! Even in rougher seas with the water splashing over your head, they kept a seal. No water in my ears at all! I’ll be recommending and purchasing more!
customer_reviews.author: Jess S.

customer_reviews.title: These work and great value for surfing, maybe not comp swimmimg!
customer_reviews.text: Having Surfer’s ear from a lifetime of water exposure and having tried all the expensive “surf plugs” with little cords etc. The cords help them get yanked out. Argh! Tried the wax ones too, never sealed, wax and sand, not a good mix=nuisance. Added these on and love that they don’t cut out sound too badly so I can still converse in the water and wallah, no more ear infections. I never lose them in the water only getting them back to the little case. Drop some on both my son’s and friends as a preventative measure, love the price. Don’t spend $16-18 at the surf shop, try these.
customer_reviews.author: Loni

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: As I have gotten older, I find that water in my ears makes me crazy. It doesn't drain out like it used to. I am in the middle of a mid life exercise crisis and I want to add swimming to the mix but swimming freestyle constantly fills my ears with water. I find the silicone gels just don't stay in my ears so I was looking for something more substantial. These do the trick. Swam 18 lengths today. No water. One stop for an adjustment. They float and allow sound to come in well so you don't need to remove them to have a conversation. Highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: HJeffK

customer_reviews.title: Looks impressive, but hard to align and doesn't seal all that well under all conditions.
customer_reviews.text: Now I've gone out and bought three sets of earplugs to try the different styles. This particular one looked really great. I figured the curved section could help seal out water, but I was wrong, the surrounds will flap over, and funnel water in your ear if you are doing anything aggressive, like an fast freestyle, feet first jump, or low dive. Putting them in is also inconvenient, the left and right plugs are counterintuitively reversed in the case, and you have to get them perfectly clocked/positioned into your ear, or else they won't seal. I found standard straight plugs worked better.
customer_reviews.author: Fleetside Garage

customer_reviews.title: Complex insertion : useful to have a second person to help
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it'll get better over time or maybe I'm just fumble fingered, but seating these in the ear channel is a time-consuming and tricky manoeuvre (for me). All ears are different, tho. My suggestion would be to have them different colors for easy identification : left or right ear. The little etched L and R are too small to see. Maybe time will make it clear and if so, I'll get back and edit this.
customer_reviews.author: Harbor Square

customer_reviews.title: Great for Surfing
customer_reviews.text: Bought these about 8 months ago and use them almost every session (2-3 session per week) for NorCal waters to prevent exostosis. These things are awesome. I lick them and pop them in while suiting up to create a better seal. They stay in my ears and have never fallen out and I've taken them out on well overhead days. After taking waves I do have to tilt my head to the side and push the tab forward to let some water drain out so I can hear again. Hearing is not great but hey, would you rather have your buddies speak up a bit while you're out there or have a surgeon drill into your ear canal?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They fit perfectly and they work!
customer_reviews.text: They're perfect! They fit great, no water in my ears, never fell out (used at least 10 times so far in open water and in the pool), and I love having the little case they came with. I'm having a little bit of a hard time seeing the R and L on them to figure out which one goes to which ear, but it's probably because I don't wear my glasses when I'm swimming. Maybe if they'd be highlighted in a different color, that would great, but it's not a deal breaker. Great product and recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Ski Mtns

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while
customer_reviews.text: Good first set - I had just started swimming and did not know if I would stick to it, so did not want to spend a lot of money on accessories. This was a good purchase to test that out, but only worked well for a couple of months. If you know you will be using this for a while, I would invest in a higher quality product. Otherwise, it is a good as a short-term "tester".
customer_reviews.author: Dani Rossi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, great value
customer_reviews.text: This is the only type of earplug I use--they fit perfectly, I love the way they block water while still allowing you to hear, and the price is great. I would give FIVE stars if they colored the case. I'm blind without my glasses, which I don't wear in the pool, obviously. When I get out of the pool, I often can't find the clear case on the white tiles. It's a little annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni Spinner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for about 10 hours in a pool so far. They are very comfortable and have kept all water out of my ears, and seem secure enough that I'm not worried about losing them. I can hold a conversation with them in place, so long as the person I'm talking to is within a few feet. BUT they still block a lot more of the sound than I would like. They also don't float, if the central cylinder (which is open at the outer end) becomes filled with water.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: It wasn't like they were just a little bit off
customer_reviews.text: So I tried these on when I first got them before even going to the pool and they did not fit at all. I don't know why I would think that a pre-mold ear plug would fit my ears. It wasn't like they were just a little bit off, in the regards of not fitting but these were not even remotely close. Luckily enough I bought a second kind just in case, and would recommend Mack's Earplugs. I have plenty of TYR products but this one just did not work out real well.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Valoroso

customer_reviews.title: They stay in without a problem and don't impact your hearing
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of shaking water out of my ear for hours after swimming and I'm thrilled to finally find some earplugs that will do the job. They are easy to pop into your ears and once in you still have no problem hearing other people talking to you. I hardly notice them when I'm swimming, but sometimes when I first pop up to take a break I get that "water in the ear" feeling before it quickly dissipates. The case is pretty flimsy and will just break if you don't open it slowly, but the ear plugs should last a while. Great little add-on item from Amazon if you're already ordering something else.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wueste

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I use it to keep water out of my ears while swimming. I prefer it to the first style I tried, which was simply silicone that you just "screwed" into your ear. This one has flaps around the "screw" which I think keeps water from entering any part of the ear. I also wear a cap which helps keep the plugs stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: jane fox

customer_reviews.title: Decent Ear Plug
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the ear plugs because I get swimmers ear fairly easily, even from a shower. The ear plugs are easy to use and come with their own storage cases. The only downside is one ear will fit great the other not so well. Some water still gets in but it’s only around the outside so you can easily use a towel to dry up these patches. They did prevent water from going into the ear fully. It works for what I need the product for.
customer_reviews.author: Amber C

customer_reviews.title: perfect earplugs for swimming
customer_reviews.text: great earplugs doesnt come out when I dive or while I swim
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Water in my hear
customer_reviews.text: I gave it a 3 stars because water still came in on my ear. They are comfortable I can hear very well with it but after 1000 meter of swimming I keep getting water in my ear. But it my be my ear it can work for you better then me
customer_reviews.author: Elvis Segovia

customer_reviews.title: maybe it's just my ears
customer_reviews.text: i had these for about 2 weeks. one would fall out of my ear during nearly every swim. i could usually find it upon falling out (although i wouldn't exactly say they always float - mostly had to find at the bottom of the pool). however, i ultimately could not find one during my last swim. when they stayed in, they seemed fine; but that kinda ain't the point... anyway, maybe it's my ears - i don't wear regular earbuds well either. not a big loss, as they are obviously affordable/replaceable, but don't really feel like having to reorder. i'll probably try some other plugs whenever i feel like placing a new order.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: if does then still leaks water pretty much. Decided to keep for the sake of ...
customer_reviews.text: Tried all possible ways to "drive" it into ear, doesnt hold weel, if does then still leaks water pretty much. Decided to keep for the sake of the case, and may be I run into someone who they will fit, to give away.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Like the material used in producing the plugs
customer_reviews.text: Going to YMCA swimming for exercise. Still in the dog paddling stage. At age 75, I still retain water in my ears. The ear plugs solved the problem. In addition to buying one pair, I bought a second set for my sister who has the same problem Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Judy Goins

customer_reviews.title: Great choice to prevent swimmers ear!
customer_reviews.text: A second pair of earplugs that I purchased in hopes of replacing the disposable silicon ones I have been buying for the last two years. I was very happy with this set of earplugs. Fit properly and kept water our of my ears. I also could hear my husband talk to me which I had been unable to with the silicon soft putty style earplugs.When I removed the TRY earplugs there was no residual pain or discomfort like I typically experience. Recommend highly. The small case is a definite bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Dreamer Moonbeam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for lap swimming and snorkeling
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use with my underwater headphones but like them so much they are now the only earplugs I wear and I Vought some for my husband too. No more ear infection's, they stay in perfect and do not hurt. Perfect with swim cap also. They surprisingly fit all ear sizes!
customer_reviews.author: maryanne

customer_reviews.title: Tried the rest , these are best !!
customer_reviews.text: I am a surfer who needs to wear plugs . I have tried and spent a lot of money on different plugs . Surfears (both types ), $200 for custom ones and lots and lots of cheapies . I need to hear because I Surf with friends and I don’t wanna be listening to my breathing and having that intense in my head feeling ! These are the best !! I can hear VERY good , they are comfy and it’s almost like your not wearing plugs at all .
customer_reviews.author: ray hartnett

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure they work fine and shes happy to have them to protect her ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a pair of these on the 1st of July for my little sister to take with us to lake havasu for 4th of July this year and they actually didn't arrive until today the 7th. I'm sure they work fine and shes happy to have them to protect her ears but they arrived quite late
customer_reviews.author: Jezzabell

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I like that these ear plugs are silicone and have the "wings" to cover more of the ear canal, but a slight bit of water still seeps into the ear.
customer_reviews.author: GZ

customer_reviews.title: Painful
customer_reviews.text: These plugs are very uncomfortable. It took me forever to get them to stay in my ears and it was painful. My ears were relieved when I removed these. Did not stop the water from entering.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safest and most comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: The TYR design is the safest and most comfortable swimming earplug I have found. It cannot be overinserted, so the inner ear is safe. It's east to remove with the wing tabs. It has a hollowed core so you can hear a lifeguard whistle. Has protected my ears from any further hydro-pneumatic trauma.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Buxton

customer_reviews.title: These are the best ear plugs tahr I have ever purchased-this is my ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the best ear plugs that I have ever purchased-this is my second pair that i have purchased. The design is the only one that I have found that is able to keep all water out of my ears while also allowing me to retain my hearing.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Prevent swimmer's ear.
customer_reviews.text: I swam for over 4 years without getting swimmer's ear, but have getting some bad cases of it the last few months, so I opted to try these at the add-on price. For the price point, it was a steal. Suffice to say, no more swimmer's ear! However, these are a little tricky to put on, so sometimes water still leaks in, but not nearly as much as swimming without them. Wish they had smaller sizes available for people with small ears such as myself. All in all, they served the purpose that I bought them for. Now let's see how long they last.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzy Jade

customer_reviews.title: difficult to stay on
customer_reviews.text: i have too many issues of the ear plug popping out whilst swimming and not realizing. they float; so it is difficult to locate in a large pool. do not recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Donald B. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: These work ok but they don't keep all the water out.
customer_reviews.author: SanaLee26

customer_reviews.title: Works well after a trial and error adjustment
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for a friend who lives in Greece and swims daily. She reports that the quality is very good, but that it took some time to adjust them to fit properly (trial and error over a period of a few days). She has tried many types of silicone ear plugs over the years and says that these are among the better versions she has used. As a note, she has large ear canals. The case that comes with the ear plugs is decent but not spectacular.
customer_reviews.author: Tula Kavadias

customer_reviews.title: Do not fit well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to keep water from my ears while swimming laps in a pool. Even wearing a swim cap to hold them in I still get water in my ears. I do not recommend this product. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Barbarajean

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the $
customer_reviews.text: Not the highest end ear plugs - but a good value for the money. Got it for surfing - probably better just for swimming.
customer_reviews.author: David G.

customer_reviews.title: work when they stay in
customer_reviews.text: I find these annoying. They work well when they stay in but they fall out CONSTANTLY! My 8yo son gets terrible swimmer's ear without ear plugs and he doesn't like the moldable kind. But I'm having to buy a swim cap for him to keep these in.
customer_reviews.author: sclubmama

customer_reviews.title: work great - just wish they had a version with a ...
customer_reviews.text: work great - just wish they had a version with a connecting line between the two. I feel like i'm going to lose one or both pretty quickly...
customer_reviews.author: beta1097

customer_reviews.title: seems to work well
customer_reviews.text: I have never used ear plugs for swimming. Having a couple "tubes" inserted in my ears last year made these required to go swimming and I love water. They fit in easily enough and can be pulled out easily enough when I grab the thin pointy flap you see on the right side of the image. So far no water has entered in the ear canal while wearing the. I do not know how long they are good for. Silicone products don't normally last a long time so I suspect a new order will be needed next year.
customer_reviews.author: Model building by Thom

customer_reviews.title: Beware, false advertisement. $7.44 shows 2 pairs, but only get one.
customer_reviews.text: It shows 2 (1 clear & 1 blue) for $7.44. But beware, it's only for one pair. Deliberate false advertisement.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: keeps water out
customer_reviews.text: I have been using those for years and they work great. I swim about once a week and can highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and works well
customer_reviews.text: I got water in my ear last summer and was unable to hear anything for a week. It was very uncomfortable. I bought these this summer to prevent it from happening again. I used them in the ocean and was very happy with the comfort and fit. I suggest this to everyone that has ear issues when in water.
customer_reviews.author: Dadera

customer_reviews.title: Silence out the world, keep the water out!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe I ever swam without! Just completed the Long Bridge Swim in Sandpoint, Idaho and not once did I feel discomfort! Would recommend for casual swimmers and IRONMAN!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Bell

customer_reviews.title: Great ear plugs
customer_reviews.text: Love these plugs that really do the trick after so many disappointing purchases. You really can hear with these on your ears. They have noT. Failed yet. Ready to purchase a second pai
customer_reviews.author: David Moriarty

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and good isolation
customer_reviews.text: Had some ear ache from my last swim and bought these. Did the trick. Used the ear plugs for the first time for a 40 minute swim. Most importantly, no leaks and good isolation. I felt it in my right ear for first 10 minutes than once got used to it, it was as I didn’t have them on.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ari

customer_reviews.title: The best earplugs for swimming.
customer_reviews.text: Great earplugs for swimming! I really love that they keep the water out, but still allow me to hear things at the pool. I don't feel so "isolated" because I can't hear anything. They stay put, and I don't think about them at all, which to me is the sign of a good product. I switched from the silicon kind you roll in your fingers them squish into place. Those kind work ok, but only for about 3 weeks before needing to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: They worked pretty well . A bit of a challenge to place them so that they form a seal
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I put the curved end facing the back of the head which works best for me
customer_reviews.text: I use these the most. I have used the soft silicone plugs but they tend to fall out. These stay in, and keep water out. I put the curved end facing the back of the head which works best for me. You may want to pull on your earlobes back when you remove the plugs so you don't hear a painful pop caused by suction when they come out.
customer_reviews.author: John Drake

customer_reviews.title: Still let's water in my ears.
customer_reviews.text: These things keep some water out but not all of it:/ I have to really shove them in there to get them to seal, but my ears are still wet after I shower.
customer_reviews.author: TheeGrace

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, stiff material
customer_reviews.text: Don't really stay in my ears, the silicone feels stiffer than normal silicone, the apparatus that should keep them in place is extremely flimsy. Bought wax plugs instead.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa WF

customer_reviews.title: A must for cold open water swim!
customer_reviews.text: I swim every week in pools and I do not use these... but when I swim in cold open waters, they are essential as I do not want to lose my hearing. They are easy to put and to remove and do the job of keeping the cold water out of my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio O. Parreiras

customer_reviews.title: Who thought ear plugs would be stylish and effective???
customer_reviews.text: No more swimmers' ear and I can still hear ambient noise as needed. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Hoaggie

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These work super. I never have water get into my ears using these and the holder case is really nice to keep them clean and dry after use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work for surfing
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work for surfing I could see this working for light swimming workout
customer_reviews.author: Alexander J Endo

customer_reviews.title: Horrible, will not stay in ear
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on the review. Tried them upon arrival, could not get the plug to stay in my ear and create a waterproof seal. I have a tube in my ear and I cannot get water in it. I tried using as much pressure as possible without causing injury to my ear, and the plug just dangles loosely in my ear. I do not recommend this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: RJK

customer_reviews.title: It's great, good fitting
customer_reviews.text: when I do free-style, my ears keep plugging up and if I swim multiple days in a row, I end up getting an ear infection. This does it job and blocks water from getting inside my ear. It's great, good fitting, and easy to use. recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Lee

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: This plug does not firmly stay in my ear. Water does enter my ear canal. I am 53 yo female who recently had the most painful episode of swimmers ear and these were of no use whst so ever
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice.
customer_reviews.text: These are a little confusing to put in the first few times, but overall, they are nice and work well. No leakage, nice bright colors. Just generally a great product. A plus is the nice case that comes with these nice ear plugs. I recommend these to almost any one. The size is kind of on the larger side, so I would look for a jr size if you have smaller ear canals.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffini L. Forsythe

customer_reviews.title: Not great, water leaks
customer_reviews.text: The previous set I has was more comfortable than this one.
customer_reviews.author: CarolP

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, but I have a hard time getting them to fit.
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time getting a good deal with these. They seem to be made for smaller ears.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: water leaks in
customer_reviews.text: Pros- They don't block out sound, which is cool. Now i can clearly hear the swim coaches bark out orders. Cons- its tough to get a good seal, if at all. Water is always getting into my ear when using these, defeating their purpose. I'm sticking to my generic swim earplugs from walgreens for now. They've never failed me.
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: feeling could be funny at the beginning because they don't deal the ear ...
customer_reviews.text: Work as they should, feeling could be funny at the beginning because they don't deal the ear canal completely and you may think you are getting water in your ears but you don't.
customer_reviews.author: REYNALDO RIOS

customer_reviews.title: comfortable but meh.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, but don't work very well to keep water out.
customer_reviews.author: Ronit Rieser

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but not at rest about water getting in
customer_reviews.text: Feel comfortable but you feel like water is in ur ear wen in a body of water
customer_reviews.author: C.K.

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: To keep water out of my ears while swimming, I have tried variety of earplugs. None have worked until I tried these; They are a perfect fit, comfortable ..... unbelievable!
customer_reviews.author: FCL

customer_reviews.title: blue not a good color when lost in the pool
customer_reviews.text: Color shouldn't be blue-really hard to find in the pool
customer_reviews.author: Susan J. Herlihy

customer_reviews.title: Not one-size-fits-all
customer_reviews.text: They are too big for my ears and won't stay in even when I am standing still They seems to have the right curve for the outer part but the plug part is too long for my ear canal. You should not buy them if you have any reason to think you have small ears, and certainly not for children or teens..
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Metivier

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of these ear plugs last summer. They do a great job in preventing water from getting into my ears. They are easy to use and I've never had a problem with them falling out. I agree with the description where it states that there is little disruption to your hearing. I've noticed that I can hear almost as well with them in as I can hear without them in, so that certainly helps especially when you're swimming with other people. I would definitely recommend these for anyone who gets swimmer's ear like I do. I use them in the pool and the shower and they work very well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Rychlik

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit small ears
customer_reviews.text: They seem like they worked for my husband, however they wouldn't stay in my small ears. I have issues with my ear so I thought I would try plugs while swimming, but couldn't get them to stay in sadly.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrinsa

customer_reviews.title: Happy and Dry!
customer_reviews.text: ONLY plugs that work with my small ears. No water and can hear just fine. I love that they fit into the ears and not the kind that look just like plugs with stick stems. These are ergonomically shaped. Happy swimmer!
customer_reviews.author: Sassycat

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and work
customer_reviews.text: These ear plugs are very comfortable, they keep the water out and you can still hear around you . Before with my other earplugs I cannot hear the music or the lifeguard if there was an emergency. They're very comfortable and they do not make my ears sore like some other earplugs do. It took a while to get used to because they do not fit in supertight but they do the job.
customer_reviews.author: BKS

customer_reviews.title: These dont keep the water out of your ears completely ...
customer_reviews.text: These dont keep the water out of your ears completely. Swimming laps they only keep the water out for about 10 or 15 mins before slowly leaking in.
customer_reviews.author: Justin G.

customer_reviews.title: These are a great replacement to my wax
customer_reviews.text: These are a great replacement to my wax. Love that I can hear what people are saying around me. Work perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't keep water out. I have a hard time ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't keep water out. I have a hard time with ear plugs so not necessarily a reflection on the product, just didn't work for me. Didn't stay in well, water leaked in.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie H.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but not a perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this product is great. When it is placed correctly on my ear, does the job perfectly and does not bother me. I can hear people talking to me at the poolside without needing to take them out. Only draw back is that because of the shape of one of my ears, one of them doesn't sit properly and falls off or lets water in sometimes. For the price and quality, it was a good buy. I wish the silicone was a bit more moldable to improve fit.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I love these because I can still hear with them in. Works really well if you're at a triathlon and want to be ready but also want to hear the announcer, or if you're swimming in a group so you can hear others, or practicing in open water so you can be more aware of what's around you. Definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sink not float
customer_reviews.text: For something that is supposed to go in the water, you would think that these would float instead of sink, only got to use them once before they fell out of ears and fell to the bottom of a lake and we're never to be found again
customer_reviews.author: Rich schell

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I just tried these for the first time this past weekend. Wow. I could hear at the same time that I was swimming, but water stayed out of my ears. I had some trouble trying to put them on the first time, but once I got them figured out it was pretty easy. I'm looking forward to more non-crinkly-ears swims in the near future!
customer_reviews.author: V. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: I can hear while Boogie boarding!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe they actually keep out water at the same time you can hear through them
customer_reviews.author: futurewave

customer_reviews.title: great product!
customer_reviews.text: They are comfortable and I don't get water in my hears during triathlons! :)
customer_reviews.author: noemi

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality; I have bought these already a couple years ago and just wanted to replace them as I did not store them well other way they can easily last years. Very comfortable and would strongly suggest buying these over the others (I have tried others and none were as comfortable and long lasting as these ones).
customer_reviews.author: Claudio

customer_reviews.title: These do the job!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I'm new to lap lane swimming and kept getting water in my ears which would stop my progress. I tried the wax but it was difficult to mold and didn't stay in. These insert easily and keep all the water out. They stay in pretty well though I did lose one until I bought the swim headband that covers my ears to help keep them in place. I've already purchased 3 pair just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Jenbc23

customer_reviews.title: Too big and poor design
customer_reviews.text: Too big for my ears, won't insert at all. Nothing molded about them apart from the extra plastic they added which has no function except for making them hard to put in since they only fit one ear in one orientation.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Great for tri training
customer_reviews.text: Takes Awhile to find the right placing in your ear but works great once you find the right spot
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are the best! Easy in and out. Keeps your ears nice and dry! A++
customer_reviews.author: D. Kosonovich

customer_reviews.title: Very nice material
customer_reviews.text: I think these are nice but there's 2 things that lead to my 3-star review and not higher. Both reasons are specific to me so I wouldn't hold it against the item at all. 1. I go in the ocean and sand will stick to these. 2. I don't think of using them often enough. One issue that is the fault of manufacturer is the case latch broke and that was pretty annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Smith

customer_reviews.title: Eliminated my ear trouble with daily swimming
customer_reviews.text: These little wonders fit easily in my ear, never come out accidentally, float if I drop them, dry quickly in their case (which leaves the canal open to the air -- nice design), and without dropping the sound level too much. Best I've used in 20 I've tried over the years. Have had my first pair for over a year. Bought another for a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Gulf Coast Swimmer

customer_reviews.title: TOO Big - Worthless
customer_reviews.text: They are too big and just pop out. Don' waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Aunt Shoes

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes need adjusting
customer_reviews.text: Need to adjust every 200m or so. But other than that are okay.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit and Feel
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for a few weeks and will be ordering a few more for a trip this summer. Love the water protect your ears.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy About

customer_reviews.title: Good  fit
customer_reviews.text: Nice fit, blocks the water and my cap does not pushes on them.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, they stay in my ear and block noise. I just need them for musical performance and I do not use them for swimming. For my needs they are just right, but no other earplugs will stay in my ears!
customer_reviews.author: Brook

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable fit. These work a little better than the ...
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable fit. These work a little better than the traditional plug type I’ve used before.
customer_reviews.author: Otigu

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work at keeping the water out. I’ve tried ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work at keeping the water out. I’ve tried multiple times, re-reading the directions, thinking it was user error. Nope.
customer_reviews.author: Horuslena

customer_reviews.title: Greatest ear plugs
customer_reviews.text: Love em saved my ears. must have if your swimming alot
customer_reviews.author: Andymandrone

customer_reviews.title: Most Comfortable ear plugs!
customer_reviews.text: If you need ear plugs when you swim, these are the pair you need!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Barsantee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: they work well and I have screwy canals - different sizes
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: These did not keep the water out of my ears
customer_reviews.author: J. Eckart

customer_reviews.title: but they did get here on time and they look very nice.
customer_reviews.text: well we got these a couple of days ago. went to the doctor found out our son needs another ear surgery. so we wont know if these will work or not for him. but they did get here on time and they look very nice.
customer_reviews.author: shaw22

customer_reviews.title: Unsuccessful
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are hard to read, plugs do not stay in ears, tried several times and they do not stay put.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Great product!! Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent buy!! I wear them while swimming laps and they never leak and are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Yooper

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price.
customer_reviews.text: They did let water come into my ear canal. And I was doing all kinds of crazy swimming in my pool. But I guess they weren't too bad for the price I paid for. They do float if they come off, which is a plus. But they are hard to find since they blend in with the water.
customer_reviews.author: David Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Didn't stay in my daughters ear
customer_reviews.text: Kept falling out of my daughters ear while at swim practice.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan L.

product_meta.title: TYR Silicone Molded Ear Plugs
product_meta.description:
TYR Sport was established in 1985 to provide the competitive swim market with vibrant, performance-driven prints. Since its inception three decades ago, TYR has grown to exist as one of the world’s most recognizable swimming and triathlon brands. With global distributors and an international following, TYR remains dedicated to building the industry’s most durable, uniquely designed swimsuits, cutting edge equipment and innovative caps and goggles. On a relentless path to push the limits of sportswear we not only reimagine technologies for enhanced competitive performance, but also embrace lifestyle markets to accommodate athletes and water enthusiasts at every level.

Features a hollow stem to ensure minimal hearing disruption while swimming
